title: Ping Issues after 6.9
body:
Before patching I had a constant ping of around 62 with no issues.  After this patch I'm having ping constantly of about 106.  I checked many different speed test sites and they all said my ping was fine.  I reinstalled league and the problem is still persisting.  It is playable, but frustrating, as my internet is fine, but for some reason my ping is way above what it should normally be.  I'm not really sure what to do I tried everything I could think of if anyone can help that would be great.  Thanks!

Edit: I tried: ipconfig /flushdns, release, renew none of them helped.  I also reset my router multiple times that did not help either.  I am fairly sure it is not my internet as I have been playing other games with my normal ping and when I did a speed test it also was normal

Edit:   I have been reading through the replies and it seems that people with frontier are getting routed to seattle.  I also have Frontier as my ISP and I assume many other people who play league do too.  Hopefully riot will fix this soon

replies.body:
***EDIT:***  From our investigation, it appears that the issue is on Frontier's end.  We have attempted to reach out to them to see if we can help get this resolved, but have been unable.  We'll keep you guys posted if we learn any more.

---------------------

Hey guys,

Definitely want to look into this Frontier ISP issue further.  To help us out, if you are experiencing this issue, [run a trace route to the NA Game Servers](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) and copy/paste the results in this thread.

Thanks for the update. I assumed it was on Frontier's end, and it is pointless to try to call them. If you think it is rough to get them to respond, you should try being forced into being their customer.

If he lives in AZ/NM (Reservation) area don't even bother dear sir. I've used the service recently and they take forever to even do a simple line check. (1 - 2 weeks) They offer speeds of 1mbps(remote areas)  - 6mbps (12 within 1 mile of the server in a decent sized city like shiprock NM).

I'm normally used to have around 35-40ping out here in NYC, using TWC. But since a week ago, it's been sitting around 120-180 which isn't too bad. But the issue is that there some brief moments where I have sub 50 ping followed by long periods of higher ping. It's just not stable or consistent at all. Here is the associated tracert:

Living in the country with windstream i would play at 69 pings around there. .. At times it would hit 200-300 but that is okay because I am used to it. But ever sicne the 6.9 patch it is different. I am used to 200-300, However, I am no where close to being able to play at 500-2.8k ping. the spike is incredible. at times i could have 600 and suddenly i'll shoot up to 2.8k. This issue has occured once 6.9 hit. IF you could please check all your servers and your connections, there may be a losse bolt somewhere. Althougth I know windstream is not reliable with their net, I am sure that this situation with the ping is not windstreams fault since it never shot up to 600-2.8k before for no apparent reason.

I have enjoyed playing League for many years now with a consistent ping of 70. Since patch 6.9 myself and many other users are experiencing frequent lag spikes in game of up to 200-500. Even my use on this website is affected by lag issues but I am not having difficulty on any other web or game service. The game isn't playable right now for me. I have confidence that Riot will fix it, but many people are posting about it in threads right now and I haven't seen any notice put out that they are aware its a serious issue affecting this many people. I would really like to.

From my experience, ping has been high since the server issues last week. It's just kinda getting worse and worse... Also, I have Frontier Communications as my ISP. Typical ping was 60-62, up to 75 with a large load. Now it's 105-125 with a ton of lag spikes and ping hopping up to the 300s and even 400s.
My latency increased by 20ms after this patch. I am also getting random lag spikes/frame skipping.

I have frontier also went from 45 to 80... do not like

Edit: Apparently this was something that was supposed to have been avoided since Frontier apparently was partnered with Riot for their Server Roadmap plan. Im guessing something changed at Frontier that is routing us through seattle now
I'm getting it also. I have frontier DSL, and after running a trace route it seems as though I'm getting routed to Seattle then back to Chicago. No idea why, but just started recently.
